column28: TO COMPENSATE THE CONTRACTOR FOR PROVIDING A (STATION REQUEST)  BY-PASS ON THE NEW OXYGEN MAIN PIPING SYSTEM TO ENABLE WORK TO BE PERFORM WITHOUT SHUTTING DOWN THE ENTIRE SYSTEM.
TO COMPENSATE THE CONTRACTOR FOR REMOVING CONTAMINATED SOIL FROM THE SITE TO AN APPROVED LANDFILL.

THE REMOVAL OF ABANDONED DIESEL FUEL OIL TANKS AND THE SUBSEQUENT SOILS TESTING REVEALED THAT THERE WAS HIGH LEVELS OF CHEMICALS ASSOCIATED WITH DIESEL FUEL PRESENT IN THE SOILS IN THE AREA. THIS CHANGE IS TO PERMIT ADDITIONAL TESTING TO BE PERFORMED ON THE SITE TO AIDE IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE CONTAMINATION AND THE SUBSEQUENT EXTENT OF THE CONTAMINATION WHICH WILL BE USE TO DEVELOP A REMEDIATION PLAN.
TO COMPENSATE THE CONTRACTOR FOR CUTTING REBAR AT BASE PLATES AND FURNISHING AND INSTALLING WELDABLE REBAR PER RFI-0486 AND RFI-0502.

MECHANIC DESIGN DRAWINGS SHOW BOTH E F BUT ELECTRICAL DRAWING DO NOT SHOW ANY INFORMATION FOR POWER OR CONNECTION FOR EF 22 OR EF 23. THIS PO AUTHORIZES CONTRACTOR TO INSTALL CONDUIT AND PULL WIRES TO POWER BOTH EF 22 AND 23.

THE REMOVAL OF ABANDONED DIESEL FUEL OIL TANKS AND THE SUBSEQUENT SOILS TESTING REVEALED THAT THERE WAS HIGH LEVELS OF CHEMICALS ASSOCIATED WITH DIESEL FUEL PRESENT IN THE SOILS IN THE AREA. THIS CHANGE IS TO PERMIT ADDITIONAL TESTING TO BE PERFORMED ON THE SITE TO AIDE IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE CONTAMINATION AND THE SUBSEQUENT EXTENT OF THE CONTAMINATION WHICH WILL BE USE TO DEVELOP A REMEDIATION PLAN.
TO COMPENSATE THE CONTRACTOR FOR PROVIDING FLEXIBLE DUCT TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY AIR CONDITIONING TO ROOM 1F-109 WHILE THE CURRENT DUCTWORK IS DOMED TO PERMIT CONTRACT REQUIRED WORK TO BE PERFORMED.

ON NOVEMBER 1, 2012 THE CONTRACTOR NOTIFIED GOVERNMENT THAT RICOH MODEL C4501G DIGITAL COLOR IMAGING SYSTEM WAS DISCONTINUED AND ITS INVENTORY DEPLETED. THE CONTRACTOR SUBMITTED RICOH MODEL C4502G DIGITAL COLOR IMAGING SYSTEM AS A POTENTIAL REPLACEMENT SUBJECT TO GOVERNMENT S APPROVAL. THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE DELIVERY ORDER WOULD REMAIN IN EFFECT AND ONLY THE RICOH MODEL WOULD CHANGE. FURTHERMORE THE CONTRACTOR STATED THAT THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE REPLACEMENT. ON NOVEMBER 6, 2012, BERTINA FEATHERSTON, ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER, OSP, REVIEWED THE SPECIFICATIONS, AND APPROVED THE REPLACEMENT ITEMS.

THIS ADMINISTRATIVE MODIFICATION PA28, FOR CONTRACT GS-01P-07-BZ-C-0006, IS HEREBY EXECUTED TO MODIFY THE CONTRACT AND EFFECTUATE AN OFFICIAL CHANGE OF NAME OF THE CONTRACTOR.  FROM: TENG&ASSOCIATES, INC.    TO: EXP FEDERAL INC.

PER FAR 43.103(B), FAR PART 42.1202, FAR PART 42.1203, FAR PART 42.1205, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION WAS OBTAINED FROM TENG&ASSOCIATES, INC. BY GSA REGION 1 TO REVIEW AND APPROVE SUCH NAME CHANGE:

1.  WRITTEN REQUEST FROM THE CONTRACTOR TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICER, KATHRYN THOMAS.

2. DOCUMENT REFLECTING THE NAME CHANGE, AND AUTHENTICATED BY PROPER OFFICIAL OF THE STATE OF ILLINOIS HAVING JURISDICTION.

3.  WRITTEN OPINION OF THE LEGAL COUNSEL OF THE FIRM SEEKING THE NAME CHANGE.

4.  PROPOSED NAME CHANGE AGREEMENT (3 COPIES).

THE CONTRACTING OFFICER HAS OBTAINED DOCUMENTATION INDICATING THE GOVERNMENT COUNSEL FOR GSA REGION 1 HAS REVIEWED FOR LEGAL SUFFICIENCY.

THE CONTRACTING OFFICER, WITH AFFIRMATIVE ADVICE FROM GSA LEGAL COUNSEL, HAS DETERMINED THAT THIS NAME CHANGE IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.

column28:
THIS MODIFICATION IS BEING ISSUED TO REFLECT A SUMMARY OF NEGOTIATED SCOPE ADDITIONS FOR THE NEW U.S. FEDERAL COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN BAKERSFIELD, CA.  THE SUMMARIES OF SCOPES ARE AS FOLLOWS:

SECURITY ADDITIONS: $27,896.00
PROVIDE AND INSTALL ADDITIONAL SECURITY INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING BACK BOXES, JUNCTION BOXES, CONDUIT, AND PULL WIRE IN ACCORDANCE WITH USMS COMMENTS GENERATED IN A LATE CONSTRUCTION WALK-THROUGH.
CITY WATER SERVICES CONNECTION FEE:  $6,533.66
PROVIDE AND INSTALL THROUGH CALIFORNIA WATER SERVICE COMPANY FIRE PROTECTION SERVICE AND RELATED APPURTENANCES.  
QEI INSPECTOR:  $4,404.65
PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL INSPECTION SERVICES OF A QEI CERTIFIED ELEVATOR INSPECTOR FOR WHEELCHAIR LIFTS IN COURTROOM.
REVISE LECTERN:  $2,276.60
REVISE THE DESIGN OF THE COURTROOM LECTERN TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE DESIGN IN ANOTHER PROJECT (SAN DIEGO COURTHOUSE) TO CONSOLIDATE LECTERN AND SEPARATE VIDEO CART TO A SINGLE PIECE DESIGN.
REMOVE AND RE-INSTALL CEILING TILE:  $3,981.37
REMOVE AND REINSTALL CEILING TILE IN SPECIFIED AREAS TO ACCOMMODATE CABLE INSTALLATION BY TENANT VENDORS.
REVISE REGULATORY SIGN:  $4,809.50
PROVIDE AND INSTALL REVISE REGULATORY SIGN AT BUILDING ENTRY.
CONDUIT AND BACK BOX FOR SECURITY CAMERA:  $495.48
PROVIDE AND INSTALL CONDUIT AND BACKBOX AT SALLYPORT FOR SECURITY CAMERA (BY OTHERS). THOUGH THE CAMERA IS THE MARSHALS RESPONSIBILITY FOR INSTALLATION, THE CONDUIT AND INFRASTRUCTURE IS REQUIRED BY GSA.
REPLACE DAMAGED CEILING TILE:  $12,547.00
REPLACE DAMAGED CEILING TILES CAUSED BY OTHERS.  FOLLOWING THE DEVELOPMENT AND CORRECTION OF DEFICIENCIES IDENTIFIED IN THE PUNCHLIST, VENDORS FOR COURTS AND MARSHALS ACCESSED THE CEILING PLENUM TO INSTALL ADDITIONAL DEVICES AND CABLE.  AS A RESULT, CEILING TILES WERE REMOVED, DAMAGED AND REQUIRED REPLACEMENT.   
REVISE SIGNAGE:  $8,324.67
FOLLOWING THE REVIEW OF A SIGNAGE PACKAGE, THE TENANT REPRESENTATIVES REQUESTED CHANGES IN THE SIGNAGE SCHEDULE FOR ROOM NAMES AND WAY FINDING.  THE RESULT IS A NET ADDITION (CONSIDERING SOME SIGNS WERE DELETED) IN SIGNAGE REQUIREMENTS IN THE BASE BUILDING.
DELETE BENCHES:  CREDIT ($1,500.00)
DELETE SPECIFIED PARK BENCHES AT BUILDING EXTERIOR.  THE DESIGN INCLUDED THREE CONCRETE BENCHES FOR SEATING.  SECURITY CONCERNS WERE RAISED IN THAT THE BENCHES ARE CONSIDERED AN ATTRACTIVE NUISANCE GIVEN THE TRANSIENT POPULATION AT THE ADJACENT PARK.
ADD DATA AND POWER AT LOBBY:  $2,201.50
ADD POWER AND DATA OUTLET AT BUILDING ENTRY LOBBY TO SUPPORT TENANT PROVIDED MONITOR.
POWER AND CONDUIT DOOR NO. #MS-C5 ARMORY:  $358.65
ADD POWER AND INFRASTRUCTURE FOR DOOR #MS-C5 USMS ARMORY.  THE REQUEST IS FOR LOW VOLTAGE POWER AND CONDUIT WITH PULL STRING TO SUPPORT FUTURE ELECTRIC HARDWARE.
POWER OUTLET AT JURY ROOM:  $560.59
ADD NEW POWER RECEPTACLE IN JURY DELIBERATION ROOM.  THE CHANGE IS IN RESPONSE TO A REQUEST FROM THE DISTRICT COURT TO ADD POWER IN THE JURY DELIBERATION ROOM.  THE NEW OUTLET WILL BE USED FOR A REFRIGERATOR FOR JURY USE DURING DELIBERATIONS. 
EIGHT (8) NEW POWER RECEPTACLES IN SERVER ROOM:  $1,772.44
ADD NEW POWER RECEPTACLE IN SERVER ROOM.  THE NEW OUTLETS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE POWER TO EQUIPMENT RACKS FOR COURT SERVERS.
DELETE ADDITIONAL SITE LIGHTING:  CREDIT ($32,999.00)
THE DELETION IS REQUIRED SINCE THE LIGHTING WAS REQUIRED TO SUPPORT SECURITY CAMERAS AND THE CAMERAS SELECTED ARE LOW LIGHT TECHNOLOGY, THEREBY OBVIATING THE NEED FOR LIGHTING.
  
THIS MODIFICATION IS IN THE AMOUNT OF $41,663.11 AS NEGOTIATED AND ACCEPTED AND NO TIME EXTENSION WILL BE ADDED TO COMPLETE THIS WORK.  THE CURRENT TOTAL AMOUNT OF THIS CONTRACT IS $24,567,968.50

column28: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO ADMINISTRATIVELY OVER OBLIGATE IN PEGASYS THE AMOUNT OF $377,000.00 FOR PV'S (SEE MODIFICATION PS26). THIS IS REQUIRED TO CREATE A NEW LINE ITEM TO BE CODED AS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT AND ALLOW THE CFO TO PERFORM A COST TRANSFER. THE ORIGINAL LINE ITEM FOR PV'S IN PS08 WILL BE DEOBLIGATED IN ITS ENTIRETY OF THE COST TRANSFER.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO ADMINISTRATIVELY DEOBLIGATE THE REMAINING BALANCE OF $377,000.00 IN MODIFICATION PS08 WHICH WAS UPWARDLY ADJUSTED BY MODIFICATION PA38.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO DEFINITIZE PC36 WHICH WAS IN THE AMOUNT OF $500.00 FOR THE INSTALLATION OF WHIPS FOR THE NEW U.S. FEDERAL COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN BAKERSFIELD, CA.

ALL OTHE TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME. 

IN CONSIDERATION OF THIS MODIFICATION AGREED TO HEREIN AS A COMPLETE AND EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT OF BOTH COST AND TIME FOR THE WORK INCORPORATED IN THIS CHANGE, THE CONTRACTOR HEREBY RELEASES THE GOVERNMENT FROM ANY FURTHER LIABILITY UNDER THIS CONTRACT FOR ANY ADDITIONAL EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MODIFICATION.
column43: SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT FOR WORK WITHIN SCOPE

column28:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO REDUCE MODIFICATION PS08 BY $798,373.86 LEAVING $377,000 (THE AMOUNT DEFINITIZED ON MARCH 08, 2012 - PS26).  THIS AMOUNT MUST REMAIN IN PEGASYS SO AS TO ALLOW FINANCE TO DO A FUTURE COST TRANSFER OF THE FUNDS.  UPON THE DEOBLIGATION OF THE $798,373.86, THE CONTRACTING OFFICER WILL CUT A MODIFICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $377,000.00 FROM THE EXPIRED FUNDS.  THIS WILL BE DONE AS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT.  THE CFO WILL THEN PERFORM A COST TRANSFER FROM THE ORIGINAL REMAINING FUNDS IN PS08 TO THE NEW MODIFICATION.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE CONTRACTING OFFICER TO DEOBLIGATE THE REMAINING FUNDS FROM MODIFICATION PS08.

BACKGROUND:
ON MARCH 8, 2012 THE CONTRACTING OFFICER DEFINITIZED THE PS08 MODIFICATION FOR PV'S IN THE AMOUNT OF $377,000.  BECAUSE THE IG HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ORIGINAL MODIFICATION WAS NOT A VALID AUTHORIZATION, AND THE DEFINITIZATION OF THE PV'S DID NOT TAKE PLACE PRIOR TO SEPTEMBER 30, 2011, THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PV'S, IN THE AMOUNT OF $377,000.00 MUST BE RE ISSUED AS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT.

THE REGIONAL RECOVERY EXECUTIVE, REGIONAL COUNSEL, AND THE REGIONAL PROCUREMENT OFFICER HAVE REVIEWED THIS MODIFICATION AND ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT THE DEFINITIZATION OF THE PV'S IS A VALID UPWARD ADJUSTMENT UNDER THE REGULATIONS SET FORTH REGARDING EXPIRED FUNDS.  PV'S ARE INTENDED TO INCREASE THE SUSTAINABLE FEATURES OF THE BAKERSFIELD COURTHOUSE.  THEY ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE BUILDING.  THERE IS A LEGITIMATE NEED TO INCREASE THE USE OF PV'S TO SUPPORT THE PRESIDENT'S INITIATIVE ON SUSTAINABLE DESIGN UNDER THE ARRA PROGRAM.

column28:
PROJECT: ARRA ADVANCED LIGHTING RETROFIT
RONALD DELLUMS FB, OAKLAND, CA

THIS IS A UNILATERAL MODIFICATION TO EXTEND THE TERM OF THE CONTRACT TO 11/30/2012 SOLELY FOR GSA INTERNAL ACCOUNTING PURPOSES. THIS MODIFICATION IN NO WAY CHANGES PRICE, TERMS OR CONDITIONS TO INCLUDE EXISTING REQUIRED COMPLETION DATES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO PROVIDE CLOSE OUT PHASE SERVICES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION MANAGER AS DEFINED IN THE BASIC SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE NEW U.S. FEDERAL COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN BAKERSFIELD, CA.

THE BASE CONTRACT INCLUDED CLOSE OUT PHASE SERVICES INCLUDING COLLECTION OF FINAL PROJECT DOCUMENTATIONS, TRAINING FOR THE PROPERTY MANAGER ON CONSTRUCTION METHODS IN THE PROJECT, SECURING CLOSE OUT DOCUMENTS AND RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE DESIGN-BUILD CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT WAS DELAYED AND PROVIDED TIME EXTENSION WHICH REQUIRED THE CM CONTRACT TO BE EXTENDED AS WELL. SINCE ARRA PROJECTS DID NOT HAVE CONTINGENCY, THE FUND SOURCE FOR EXTENDING CM SERVICES WAS SECURED BY DEDUCTING FROM CLOSE OUT PHASE SERVICES ALREADY ON CONTRACT. SINCE THAT OSTENSIBLY DELETED THE SERVICE AT THE TIME, THE NEED FOR CLOSE OUT PHASE IS STILL VALID AND ESSENTIAL TO SUCCESSFUL CLOSE OUT AND TURNOVER OF THE BUILDING TO THE PROPERTY MANAGER.

THIS MODIFICATION IS IN THE AMOUNT OF $79,107.60 AS NEGOTIATED AND ACCEPTED AND AN EXTENSION OF 65 DAYS IS ADDED TO THE CONTRACT.  THE 65 DAYS WILL COMMENCE UPON RECEIPT OF THE CONTRACTING OFFICER'S SIGNED SF30.  THE CURRENT TOTAL AMOUNT OF THIS CONTRACT IS $2,209,533.60.

IN CONSIDERATION OF THIS MODIFICATION AGREED TO HEREIN AS A COMPLETE AND EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT OF BOTH COST AND TIME FOR THE WORK INCORPORATED IN THIS CHANGE, THE CONTRACTOR HEREBY RELEASES THE GOVERNMENT FROM ANY FURTHER LIABILITY UNDER THIS CONTRACT FOR ANY ADDITIONAL EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MODIFICATION.

UPON COMPLETION OF ALL WORK TO INCLUDE PUNCH-LIST CORRECTION AND SUBMISSION OF COMPLETE AND ACCURATE DOCUMENTS, GSA WILL ACCEPT A CORRECT INVOICE WITH EXECUTED RELEASE OF CLAIMS FOR REMAINING CONTRACT BALANCE. 

IN CONSIDERATION OF THIS EXTENSION, THE FIRM FIXED CONTRACT PRICE IS REDUCED FROM $382,630.00 BY $16,450.00 TO $366,180.00. CR112, CR145, CR148, CR154, CR156, CR157, CR174

GS-05P-09-GB-D-0015/GS-P-05-09-GB-5045/PS63/PN9E02354
CONSTRUCTION MANAGER AS CONSTRUCTOR (CMC) SERVICES FOR THE MODERNIZATION OF THE JOHN WELD PECK FEDERAL BUILDING, CINCINNATI, OHIO
CR112, CR145, CR148, CR154, CR156, CR157, CR174

MODIFICATION PS63, IS HEREBY ISSUED TO INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING:

CR112, THE SCOPE OF THIS WORK IS TO DELETE THE REMAINING DUCT CLEANING ON THIS PROJECT AS CLEANING WAS NOT EFFECTIVE IN REDUCING THE BLACK DEBRIS THAT WAS COMING OUT OF THE DUCTS. THIS MODIFICATION REMOVES THIS WORK FROM THE CONTRACT.  THE AMOUNT TO BE CREDITED UNDER CR 112 IN REGARDS TO THIS MODIFICATION IS $25,765.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 9/7/2012 IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.

CR145, THE SCOPE OF THIS WORK IS TO NOT INSTALL TWO NEW VAV'S IN THE IRS COMPUTER ROOM ON THE 7TH FLOOR. THIS MODIFICATION WILL REMOVE THIS WORK FROM THE CONTRACT.  THE AMOUNT TO BE CREDITED UNDER CR 145 IN REGARDS TO THIS MODIFICATION IS $1,119.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 1/24/2013 IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.

CR148: PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO SUPPLY AND INSTALL ALL CHANGES PER CR 148 TO PAINT AND MINOR PATCH THE UNFINISHED WALL BELOW THE NEW CEILING GRID ON FLOORS 3, 4, 5 AND 7 WHERE NEW CEILING WAS INSTALLED.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 2/4/2013, FOR $14,717, IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.  VERBAL AUTHORIZATION TO PROCEED WITH THIS WORK WAS GIVEN ON 2/22/2013.

CR154: PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO SUPPLY AND INSTALL ALL CHANGES PER CR 154 TO PAINT THE EXPOSED OFFICE SIDE (ONE SIDE ONLY) OF THE PLYWOOD PARTITION AND PLYWOOD ACCESS DOOR AT THE USCIS SWING SPACE LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE 6TH FLOOR.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 7/15/2013, FOR $525, IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.  VERBAL AUTHORIZATION TO PROCEED WITH THIS WORK WAS GIVEN ON 3/11/2013.

CR156: PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO SUPPLY AND INSTALL ALL CHANGES PER CR 156 TO TRACE ELECTRICAL CIRCUITS TO KNOW HOW A SHUTDOWN WOULD AFFECT THE BUILDING.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 3/09/2013, FOR $1,756, IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.  

CR157: PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO SUPPLY AND INSTALL ALL CHANGES PER CR 157 TO SHUTDOWN THE MAIN ELECTRICAL SWITCHGEAR.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 3/09/2013, FOR $1,831, IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.  

CR174: PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIAL AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO SUPPLY AND INSTALL ALL CHANGES PER CR 157 TO REPLACE THE 3RD FLOOR NLRB WINDOWS THAT WERE SKIPPED DURING THE ORIGINALLY SCHEDULED WORK DUE TO A TENANT CONSTRAINT.  YOUR PROPOSAL DATED 7/23/2013, FOR $26,095, IS HEREBY ACCEPTED.  

THIS MODIFICATION DECREASES THE FIN TUBE CURB PREP ALLOWANCE BY $18,040. THE CURRENT BALANCE OF THIS ALLOWANCE IS $77,498.53.

THIS IS A FIRM FIXED PRICE MODIFICATION, AND DOES NOT CHANGE THE GUARANTEED MAXIMUM PRICE AMOUNT OF $26,966,990.53.

CE5009-R1, PCO 810021R1 (5/22/13) - ON FEBRUARY 14, 2012 YOU WERE PROVIDED AUTHORIZATION VIA MODIFICATION PS48 TO REWORK THE EXISTING FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM TO PROVIDE, INSTALL AND REMOVE TEMPORARY SPRINKLER HEADS TO ENSURE AREAS WERE PROTECTED PRIOR TO THE INSTALLATION OF THE NEW SYSTEM AT THE PRICE TO BE DETERMINED LATER (PDL) NOT TO EXCEED (NTE) VALUE OF $53,054.00. ON MAY 22, 2013, CLARK SIGNED THE TRUE-UP PROPOSAL REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL WITH ACTUAL COSTS INCURRED TOTALING $42,975.00 RESULTING IN A CREDIT OF ($10,079.00).

4.  CE5159, PCO 810220 (6/11/13) - PROVIDE AND INSTALL HARDWARE OR MODIFY EXITING DOOR 2128 TO BE EXIT ONLY.

6.  CE5161, PCO 810222 (6/26/13) - PRE RFI 559R5 REVISE CONTROLS FOR EF-R-1 SO THAT THE FAN RUNS 24/7 AS REQUIRED PER THE FBI POR.

column28:
1.	THE SERVICES UNDER MODIFICATION NO. PS06: TEMPORARY HOUSING MOVE COORDINATION, PS09: ADDITIONAL ESTIMATING, AND PS11: ADDITIONAL CM SERVICES ARE NO LONGER NEEDED AND WILL BE REALLOCATED TO PROVIDE FOR SPECIAL TESTING AND INSPECTION SERVICES.  THE CM WILL BE PROVIDING SPECIAL TESTING AND INSPECTION SERVICES FOR NO ADDITIONAL COSTS AS OUTLINED IN THE HEERY LETTER DATED DECEMBER 21, 2012.

2.	IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MOU SIGNED BETWEEN GSA AND HPCC, THE CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT SERVICES HAS BEEN RESTRUCTURED TO PROVIDE A MORE STREAMLINE PROJECT OVERSIGHT WITH THE FOCUS ON QUALITY ASSURANCE AND THE LEVEL OF EFFORT IS OUTLINED IN THE HEERY LETTER DATED DECEMBER 21, 2012.  THE CONTRACT TASKS NO LONGER REQUIRED ARE HOSTING PARTNERING MEETINGS, LEADING AND DOCUMENTING THE WEEKLY OAC MEETINGS, SUBMISSION OF DETAILED WEEKLY PROGRESS REPORTS, THE REQUIREMENT FOR CREATING A MARKED UP AS-BUILT SET OF DRAWINGS, AND PROVIDING MONTHLY REPORTS AND DETAILED MANAGEMENT PLAN UPDATES.  THE CM IS TO CONTINUE TO VERIFY THAT THE CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR IS MAINTAINING AS-BUILT DRAWINGS AS THIS IS A REQUIREMENT OF THE CONTRACT AND SUBMISSION OF THE MONTHLY INVOICE FOR PAYMENT.

3.	THIS MODIFICATION PROVIDES FOR A TIME EXTENSION FROM MARCH 19, 2014 TO OCTOBER 20, 2014.  THIS IS NEEDED TO MATCH THE EXTENDED CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT COMPLETION DATE OF AUGUST 20, 2014 PLUS AN ADDITIONAL TWO (2) MONTHS FOR CLOSE OUT SERVICES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONTRACT DOCUMENTS.

THIS IS A NO COST MODIFICATION AS NEGOTIATED AND AGREED TO ON DECEMBER 21, 2012.  THE TOTAL CONTRACT AMOUNT REMAINS THE SAME, $8,717,630.66.

ALL REQUIREMENTS MUST BE COMPLETE TO INCLUDE COMPLETION OF COMMISSIONING, CORRECTION OF PUNCH-LIST DEFICIENCIES, AND ALL RECORD DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED.  RECORD DOCUMENTS MUST BE COMPLETE AND ACCURATE. THIS MODIFICATION IS SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO WAIVE THE GOVERNMENT'S RIGHTS TO CLAIM LIQUIDATED DAMAGES OR TO REQUIRE THE GOVERNMENT TO CLASSIFY PERFORMANCE AS SATISFACTORY. column28:
PROJECT: ARRA BAS RETROFIT, HVAC AND MECHANICAL IMPROVEMENT
RONALD DELLUMS FEDERAL BUILDING, OAKLAND, CA

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS AS FOLLOW: 

1. ACCOUTNING CORRECTIVE ACTION: TO CANCEL AND DEOBLIGATE THE FUNDS IN MODIFCATION PC08, IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE CONCERNS FROM THE OFFICE AND INSPECTOR GENERAL. AN AMOUNT OF $75,000.00 WILL BE DEOBLIGATED. 

PN0J00701.2011.442 .09.PG03.P0920002.N20.PGH30.VCA00052.CA0281ZZ.188<-$75,000.00>WITH THE DEDUCTION OF $75,000.00, THE TOTAL CONTRACT AMOUNT IS DECREASED FROM $4,848,955.87 TO $4,773,955.87.

2. UPWARDS ADJUSTMENT: TO INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING SCOPE OF WORK AND NEGOTIATED COSTS INTO THE CONTRACT. 

I. TO PROVIDE AND REPLACE THE HEAT EXCHANGER ISOLATION VALVE
PN0J00701.2011.442 .09.PG03.P0920002.N20.PGH30.VCA00052.CA0281ZZ.188<$15,818.00>II. TO PROVIDE AND INSTALL NEW VFD ON CT-A AND ON CPNB-
4 PUMP
PN0J00701.2011.442 .09.PG03.P0920002.N20.PGH30.VCA00052.CA0281ZZ.188<$44,355.00>III. TO PROVIDE AND INSTALL STATIC PRESSURE SENSOR
PN0J00701.2011.442 .09.PG03.P0920002.N20.PGH30.VCA00052.CA0281ZZ.188<$4,314.00>IV. TO PROVIDE HARDWARE PARTS FOR THE SERVER
PN0J00701.2011.442 .09.PG03.P0920002.N20.PGH30.VCA00052.CA0281ZZ.188<$10,141.00>IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GUIDANCE FROM CENTRAL OFFICE SHOWN IN THE ATTACHMENTS BELOW, PC08 WILL BE DELETED IN ITS ENTIRETY (-$75,000.00), AND A NEW UPWARD ADJUSTMENT FOR PS11 WILL BE EXECUTED ($74,628.00).  THE NET EFFECT TO THE CONTRACT IS A $372.00 REDUCTION.   THE AMOUNT OF $74,628.00 MUST REMAIN IN PEGASYS SO AS TO ALLOW FINANCE TO DO A FUTURE COST TRANSFER OF THE FUNDS. UPON THE DE-OBLIGATION OF $372.00, THE CONTRACTING OFFICER WILL ISSUE A MODIFICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $74,628.00 FROM THE FUNDS. THIS WILL BE DONE AS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT. THE CFO WILL PERFORM A COST TRANSFER FROM THE ORIGINAL REMAINING FUNDS IN PC08 TO THE NEW MODIFICATION PS11. THIS WILL THEN ALLOW THE CONTRACTING OFFICER TO DE-OBLIGATE THE REMAINING FUNDS FROM PC08. 

IN SUM, THE NEW CONTRACT AMOUNT AFTER THE SUBTRACTION OF THE $75,000.00 AND THE REISSUANCE OF CERTAIN LINE ITEMS IDENTIFIED THROUGH THIS MODIFICATION ABOVE FOLLOWING THE UPWARD ADJUSTMENT PROCESS, IS $74,628.00 FOR A NEW TOTAL CONTRACT AMOUNT OF $4,848,583.87.

THIS HAS THE NET EFFECT OF A DE-OBLIGATION OF $372.00 FROM THE CONTRACT NO. GS09P10KSC0040.

ARRA FUNDED: $4,848,583.87

column28:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO DEFINITIZE MODIFICATION PS06 WHICH IS FOR THE ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF THE PV'S WITH UPDATED TECHNOLOGY. 

BACKGROUND:

ON APRIL 8, 2012, PBS REGION 9 ISSUED MODIFICATION PS06 TO CONTRACT NUMBER GS09P10KTC0045 IN THE AMOUNT OF $915,575.05 FOR 221 PHOTOVOLTAIC PANELS FOR THE JOHN M. ROLL U.S. COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN YUMA, AZ.  THE CONTRACT MODIFICATION FOR PS06 INCLUDED AN INDEPENDENT GOVERNMENT ESTIMATE, A CONTRACTOR ESTIMATE, AND AN AWARD DECISION MEMORANDUM.  

FROM OCTOBER 2011 THROUGH JUNE 2012, PBS REGION 9 OFFICE OF DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION ISSUED 11 MODIFICATIONS (INCLUDING THE PV PANELS), REDUCING THE ORIGINAL BALANCE ON PS06 MODIFICATION FROM $915,575.05 FOR A REMAINDER OF $424,701.05 ($490,874.00 WAS USED).  THE FUNDS WERE USED FOR SUPERSEDING, BONA FIDES NEEDS FOR IN-SCOPE CHANGES TO THE COURTHOUSE.  THE 11TH MODIFICATION WAS THE DEFINITIZATION OF PS06 FOR THE PV S.  THE DEFINITIZATION, IN THE AMOUNT OF $116,623 OCCURRED AFTER SEPTEMBER 30, 2011 AND THEREFORE NEEDS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT.

ON MARCH 03, 2012, THE CONTRACTING OFFICER DEFINITIZED THE PS06 MODIFICATION FOR PV S IN THE AMOUNT OF $116,623.00 WHICH WAS MODIFICATION PS34.  BECAUSE THE IG HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ORIGINAL MODIFICATION (PS06) WAS NOT A VALID AUTHORIZATION, AND THAT THE DEFINITIZATION DID NOT TAKE PLACE PRIOR TO SEPTEMBER 30, 2011, THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR PV S, IN THE AMOUNT OF $116,623.00 MUST BE RE-ISSUED AS AN UPWARD ADJUSTMENT USING THE FUNDS THAT HAVE BEEN DEOBLIGATED UNDER THIS MODIFICATION.  


THE PV'S WERE ALWAYS A PART OF THE CONTRACT AND ARE INTENDED TO INCREASE THE SUSTAINABLE FEATURES OF THE JOHN M. ROLL U.S. COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN YUMA, AZ.  THERE IS A LEGITIMATE NEED TO INCREASE THE USE OF PV'S TO SUPPORT THE PRESIDENT'S INITIATIVE ON SUSTAINABLE DESIGN UNDER THE AMERICAN RECOVERY AND REINVESTMENT ACT PROGRAM.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO INCORPORATE MOD 9 AZ1 GENERAL WAGE DETERMINATION IN THE JOHN M. ROLL U.S. FEDERAL COURTHOUSE  CONSTRUCTION PROJECT.  ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO DEFINITIZE PC01 WHICH WAS IN THE AMOUNT OF $135,540.00 FOR THE COMMISSIONING OF ARTWORK FOR THE JOHN M. ROLL U.S. COURTHOUSE LOCATED IN YUMA, AZ.  

BACKGROUND:
MODIFICATION PC01 WAS ISSUED ON MARCH 03, 2011 FOR $135,540.00 TO COMMENCE EXECUTION OF AN ART COMMISSION FOR THE SUBJECT PROJECT.  COMMISSION WAS STIPULATED IN THE PROJECT AUTHORIZATION OF AN ARTIST'S COMMISSION OF $123,000.00 AND THE ARTIST PROPOSED $123,218.00 AND CONCURRED BY THE ART PANEL.  

THE COMMISSION WAS AWARDED THROUGH THE GENERAL CONTRACTOR, SUNDT CONSTRUCTION, INC. SINCE CLOSE COORDINATION IS REQUIRED WITH ARTIST JOHN BISBEE.  INCLUDED WITH THE MODIFICATION IS A MANAGEMENT FEE OF 10%,(OR $12,322.00) AS PROVIDED IN THE BASE CONTRACT.  SINCE THE ISSUANCE OF THE MODIFICATION, THE CONTRACTOR CONCURS WITH THE FEE.  THE FINAL AMOUNT OF THE DEFINITIZATION WAS AGREED BY SUNDT ON NOVEMBER 27, 2012 AS FAIR AND REASONABLE.  THEREFORE IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT MODIFICATION PC01 BE DEFINITIZED TO THE FINAL AMOUNT OF $135,540.00.

ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

IN CONSIDERATION OF THIS MODIFICATION AGREED TO HEREIN AS A COMPLETE AND EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT OF BOTH COST AND TIME FOR THE WORK INCORPORATED IN THIS CHANGE, THE CONTRACTOR HEREBY RELEASES THE GOVERNMENT FROM ANY FURTHER LIABILITY UNDER THIS CONTRACT FOR ANY ADDITIONAL EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENT ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MODIFICATION.

CONTRACT NO.: GS-09P-10-KT-C-0078
MODIFICATION PS03

THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO MUTUALLY TERMINATE THE ABOVE CONTRACT FOR CONVENIENCE AT NO FURTHER COST TO THE CONTRACTOR OR THE GOVERNMENT. THE REMAINING CONTRACT AMOUNT OF $10,000.00 IS DEDUCTED AS A RESULT OF THIS MODIFICATION.

IN ORDER TO TERMINATE THIS CONTRACT MUTUALLY AND AT NO COST, YOU SHALL STOP ALL WORK, MAKE NO FURTHER SHIPMENTS, AND PLACE NO FURTHER ORDERS RELATING TO THE CONTRACT. YOU SHALL KEEP ADEQUATE RECORDS OF YOUR COMPLIANCE WITH THIS TERMINATION SHOWING THE DATE YOU RECEIVED YOUR NOTICE OF TERMINATION, THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF SUCH TERMINATION AND THE EXTENT OF COMPLETION OF PERFORMANCE ON SUCH EFFECTIVE DATE.

YOU SHALL GIVE NOTICE OF TERMINATION TO EACH OF YOUR IMMEDIATE SUBCONTRACTORS, INCLUDING SUPPLIERS, WHO WILL BE AFFECTED BY THE TERMINATION OF YOUR CONTRACT. IN SUCH NOTICE, YOU SHALL GIVE HIM THE NUMBER OF YOUR CONTRACT WITH THE GOVERNMENT, STATE THAT IT HAS BEEN TERMINATED AT NO COST, MUTUALLY, GIVE HIM THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF THE CONTRACTING OFFICE, INSTRUCT HIM TO STOP WORK, TO MAKE NO FURTHER SHIPMENTS, TO PLACE NO MORE ORDERS AND TO TERMINATE ALL SUBCONTRACTS UNDER THIS CONTRACT WITH YOU AND REQUEST HIM TO GIVE SIMILAR NOTICE AND INSTRUCTIONS TO HIS IMMEDIATE SUBCONTRACTORS.

YOU SHALL ALSO NOTIFY THE CONTRACTING OFFICER OF ANY PENDING LEGAL PROCEEDINGS WHICH RELATE TO ANY SUBCONTRACTS OR PURCHASE ORDERS UNDER THE TERMINATED CONTACT OR WHICH HAVE RESULTED IN OR WHICH ARE INTENDED TO RESULT IN A LIEN OR ENCUMBRANCE ON ANY TERMINATION INVENTORY OTHER THAN TERMINATION INVENTORY YOU PROPOSE AND ARE AUTHORIZED TO PURCHASE, RETAIN, OR DISPOSE OF. THE CONTRACTING OFFICER SHALL ALSO BE PROMPTLY NOTIFIED OF ANY SUCH PROCEEDINGS BROUGHT AFTER RECEIPT OF THIS NOTICE.

PURSUANT TO FAR 49.603-6, THIS IS A MUTUAL, NO COST SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT:

1. THE CONTRACTOR UNCONDITIONALLY WAIVES ANY CHARGES AGAINST THE GOVERNMENT BECAUSE OF THE TERMINATION OF THE CONTRACT AND RELEASES IT FROM ALL OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE CONTRACT OR DUE TO ITS TERMINATION.

2. THIS NO COST MUTUAL TERMINATION MEANS THAT THERE IS NO COST AND/OR FEE OF ANY KIND TO THE GOVERNMENT FOR ANY TYPE OF COST AND/OR FEE FOR ANY WORK, SERVICES, AND/OR SUPPLIES, WHETHER DONE BY TIM BAVINGTON STUDIO OR ANY THIRD PARTY, INVOLVING OR RELATED TO THE ABOVE REFERENCED CONTRACT OR THIS TERMINATION, REGARDLESS OF THE TIME SUCH COST AND/OR FEE WAS INCURRED.

3. THE GOVERNMENT AGREES THAT ALL OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE CONTRACT ARE CONCLUDED.

THIS IS A NO COST MODIFICATION.  THE OVERALL CONTRACT AMOUNT REMAINS $63,980.00.  THE OVERALL CONTRACT COMPLETION DATE IS HEREBY CHANGED TO JUNE 15, 2013, AS AGREED UPON MARCH 19, 2013.  ALL OTHER CONTRACTUAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

RECOVERY - NATIONAL CLEAN DIESEL PROGRAM AMERICAN RECOVERY AND REINVESTMENT ACT (ARRA) GRANT EVALUATION
THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION 4 IS TO DEOBLIGATE $44,293.17 IN ARRA FUNDING FROM THE TASK ORDER AS THESE FUNDS ARE NOT ANTICIPATED TO BE NEEDED AT THIS TIME.  THE TASK ORDER IS EXPIRED.  THE TASK ORDER STARTED SEPTEMBER 20, 2011 AND WAS COMPLETED DECEMBER 31, 2012. 

UNDER THIS TASK ORDER, THE CONTRACTOR PROVIDED SUPPORT IN 1) EVALUATING THE NATIONAL CLEAN DIESEL CAMPAIGN'S (NCDC) AMERICAN REINVESTMENT AND RECOVERY ACT (ARRA) GRANTS, 2) IDENTIFYING AND ANALYZING THE ACTUAL EMISSIONS ATTRIBUTABLE TO ARRA-FUNDED PROJECTS, AND 3) ANALYZING THE ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS AND BENEFITS OF DIFFERENT TYPES OF ARRA PROJECTS.

THE TASK ORDER CONSISTED OF THE EVALUATION OF THE COMPLETED NATIONAL CLEAN DIESEL ARRA GRANTS.  INFORMATION GATHERED THROUGH THESE EVALUATIONS WAS USED BY THE CONTACTOR TO ASSIST EPA TO FURTHER ENHANCE FUTURE DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTION ACT (DERA) GRANTS THROUGH DATABASE IMPROVEMENTS AND STREAMLINED FUNCTIONS AND TO CONFIRM THROUGH THE DATABASE FOR REPORTING INNOVATIVE VEHICLE EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS (DRIVER) THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ARRA GOALS.

TO ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES, THE CONTRACTOR NEEDED TO UTILIZE AND HAVE EXPERIENCE AND EXTENSIVE KNOWLEDGE OF EPA'S DIESEL EMISSIONS QUANTIFIER (DEQ) AND THE DATABASE FOR REPORTING INNOVATIVE VEHICLE EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS (DRIVER). 

ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED.

REFERENCE UNDEFINITIZED CHANGE ORDER, MODIFICATION R00015, CASE SP012-1 ISSUED FOR $324,000.00 AND SKETCH 10-3004-12-1. THIS MODIFICATION FINALIZES ALL COSTS AND TIME FOR THE SCOPE OF WORK PLUS THE PREVIOUS CHANGE ORDER. THE PRICE AND TIME REFLECTED IN THIS MODIFICATION REPRESENTS THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN FINAL AMOUNT, $473,654.64, AND THE AMOUNT PREVIOUSLY ISSUED BY MODIFICATION R00015. TOTAL AMOUNT REFLECTS THE ADDITIONAL 39,471.22 BANK CUBIC YARDS (BCY) OF MATERIAL EXCAVATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLIN 0005 AT $12.00 PER BCY. FOR CLARITY, THIS MODIFICATION RESTATES THE SCOPE OF WORK AS FOLLOWS: REFERENCE CONTRACT SPECIFICATIONS SECTION 02111, EXCAVATION AND HANDLING OF CONTAMINATED MATERIALS; SECTION 02120, DISPOSAL OF EXCAVATED MATERIAL; SECTION 01450, CHEMICAL QUALITY DATA MANAGEMENT; CONTRACT DRAWINGS, SHEET 9 (PLATE NUMBER C6) EXCAVATION PLAN-TRIBUTARY CREEK FLUVIAL TAILINGS BELOW TAILINGS PILE 2, SHEET 10 (PLATE NUMBER C7) EXCAVATION PLAN-UPPER TRIBUTARY CREEK AND TAILINGS PILE 2; SHEET 11 (PLATE NUMBER C8) EXCAVATION PLAN-UPPER TRIBUTARY CREEK AND TAILINGS PILE 1; AND SHEET 13 (PLATE NUMBER C10) EXCAVATION PLAN-UPPER TRIBUTARY CREEK AND RAIL LINE. PROVIDE ALL LABOR, EQUIPMENT, AND MATERIALS NECESSARY TO EXCAVATE AN ADDITIONAL QUANTITY OF CONTAMINATED MATERIALS UP TO, BUT NOT TO EXCEED 40,000 BANK CUBIC YARDS (BCY). THE QUANTITIES SHALL BE APPLICABLE FOR REMOVAL OF REMAINING MATERIALS ABOVE THE SPECIFIED 200,000 BCY CONTRACT QUANTITY AT TAILING PILE 1, AS WELL AS THE FLUVIAL TAILINGS FROM THE CREEK AREAS UPSTREAM OF TP1 TO THE LIMITS SHOWN ON PLATES C8 AND C10 TO THE DOWNSTREAM LIMIT OF TP2 AT THE CONFLUENCE OF TRIBUTARY CREEK AND DUTHIE CREEK. ALL FLUVIAL TAILINGS CURRENTLY SPECIFIED TO BE REMOVED FROM THE DESIGNATED FLUVIAL TAILINGS AREA DOWNSTREAM OF THE DUTHIE CREEK CONFLUENCE AS SHOWN ON PLATE C6 SHALL REMAIN IN PLACE AND ARE OMITTED FROM THIS CONTRACT.

column28: THIS TASK ORDER IS TO EXAMINE HOW RECIPIENTS OF FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION FUNDS COMPLY WITH STATUTORY AND ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS FOR PROCUREMENT, ESPECIALLY THOSE THAT ARE INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES SUBMITTED BY GRANTEES.  THE PROCUREMENT SYSTEM REVIEW EXAMINES 55 ELEMENTS TO DETERMINE IF FTA GRANTEES ARE MEETING FTA PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS AND TO IDENTIFY CORRECTIVE ACTIONS IF A GRANTEE IS NOT MEETING THE REQUIREMENTS.

column27: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES
column28: TAS::80 0119::TAS ARRA THERMAL ENERGY STORAGE USING SUPERCRITICAL FLUIDS

THERMAL INFRARED SENSOR (TIRS) INSTRUMENT ENGINEERING SUPPORT SERVICES (TESS) TO SUPPORT THE LANDSAT DATA CONTINUITY MISSION(LDCM)
THE PURPOSE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO ACQUIRE ENGINEERING SERVICES, MATERIALS AND RELATED SERVICES TO THE TIRS PROJECT, AS REQUIRED, FOR THE FORMULATION, DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT, FABRICATION, INTEGRATION, TESTING, VERIFICATION, AND OPERATIONS OF SPACEFLIGHT AND GROUND SYSTEM HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE. 

TASKS ORDERS WILL BE ISSUED TO PERFORM SERVICES IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE TIRS INSTRUMENT DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION FOR COMPONENTS, SUBSYSTEMS, SYSTEMS, GROUND SYSTEM, SIMULATORS, MODELS, AND PROTOTYPES; CANDIDATE, FEASIBILITY, AND SYSTEMS DEFINITION STUDIES; PROJECT MANAGEMENT; SYSTEMS ENGINEERING; ANALYSIS; PRELIMINARY DESIGN; DETAILED DESIGN; FABRICATION; ASSEMBLY; INTEGRATION; TEST AND VERIFICATION; TEST INSTRUMENTATION; DATA SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT; POST DELIVERY SUPPORT, LAUNCH, ON-ORBIT AND POST-LAUNCH OPERATIONS; RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY UNIQUE TO SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT; PARTS AND MATERIALS, TECHNICAL FACILITIES SUPPORT, LOGISTICS, DOCUMENTATION; MAINTENANCE; SUSTAINING ENGINEERING; CONFIGURATION MANAGEMENT; INSTRUMENT ASSURANCE; ARCHITECTURAL TRADES, PERFORMANCE, COST, RISK ASSESSMENT, DOCUMENTATION, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (IT), PROJECT REVIEW AND PRESENTATION SUPPORT.

column28:
IGF::CL::IGF - IRON AIR FUEL CELL FOR LARGE SCALE ENERGY STORAGE

THE CONTRACT IS THE SPONSORING AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION (NASA) AND THE CALIFORNIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (CONTRACTOR), A PRIVATE NONPROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION, WHICH ESTABLISHES THE RELATIONSHIP FOR THE OPERATION OF THE FEDERALLY FUNDED RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT CENTER (FFRDC) KNOWN AS THE JET PROPULSION LABORATORY.
THE CONTRACTOR, JPL, IS REQUIRED TO PERFORM WORK THAT IS DESIGNATED IN TASK ORDERS ISSUED BY THE NASA MANAGEMENT OFFICE (NMO) CONTRACTING OFFICERS.
 
NASA   SPONSORED WORK: JPL S PRIMARY MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE NASA SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE (SMD) IN CARRYING OUT THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES IDENTIFIED IN THE SMD SCIENCE PLAN.  THE FOUR BROAD SCIENTIFIC AREAS ARE: EARTH SCIENCE, PLANETARY SCIENCE, HELIOPHYSICS, AND ASTROPHYSICS. 
IN PERFORMANCE OF THIS CONTRACT, JPL SHALL:
 
1) SUPPLY A BROAD BASE OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES RELEVANT TO NASA PROGRAM AND PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIES AND ASSIGNMENTS.
2) FOSTER ITS UNIQUE RELATIONSHIP WITH A TOP-TIER UNIVERSITY TO FACILITATE THE INVOLVEMENT OF SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, AND STUDENTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY AND RESEARCH COMMUNITIES IN NASA MISSION AND IN SUPPORTING OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES.
3) SUPPORT NASA IN ENABLING PROGRAM AND INSTITUTIONAL CAPABILITIES.
4) DEVELOP SPACECRAFT AND INSTRUMENTS THAT ARE SENT TO VARIOUS DESTINATIONS WITH OUR SOLAR SYSTEM, INCLUDING EARTH ORBIT, PLANETS, PLANETARY SATELLITES, ASTEROIDS, AND COMETS.  THESE MISSIONS MAY BE ORBITERS, LANDERS, OR ROVERS, AND TYPICALLY INCLUDE CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGIES REQUIRED TO MEET SCIENTIFIC REQUIREMENTS.
5) PERFORM PROJECT TASKS INVOLVING: (I) AUTONOMOUS DEEP-SPACE, INNER-SPACE AND EARTH-ORBITING SPACECRAFT OR MAJOR SUBSYSTEMS, (II) EXPERIMENTS, INSTRUMENTS, OR OTHER DEVICES WHICH MAY BE CARRIED AS PAYLOAD ON SPACECRAFTS IN MISSIONS MANAGED BY OTHERS, AND/OR (III) GROUND-BASED SYSTEMS.
6) BEYOND ITS PRIMARY MISSION, JPL MAY PERFORM WORK FOR OTHER NASA MISSION DIRECTORATES OR OFFICES.
7) JPL IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OPERATION, RESEARCH, TECHNOLOGY INSERTION, AND MANAGEMENT OF NASA S DEEP SPACE NETWORK TO PROVIDE TELECOMMUNICATION AND OPERATION SERVICES, INCLUDING DATA ACQUISITION AND DATA DELIVERY REQUIRED TO MEET ESTABLISHED AGENCY OBJECTIVES.
8) JPL IS ALSO REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN AND CONDUCT AN EDUCATION PROGRAM IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE NASA HEADQUARTERS EDUCATION OFFICE, THE ACADEMIC COMMUNITY AT LARGE, AND IN SUPPORT TO NASA STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES TO IMPROVE STUDENT RETENTION IN THE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) DISCIPLINES.
 
WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS:  JPL MAY PERFORM WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS.  THIS WORK WILL BE DESIGNATED IN TASK ORDERS ISSUED BY NMO CONTRACTING OFFICERS BASED ON TASK PLANS INITIATED BY THE CONTRACTOR.

column27: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT BIOTECHNOLOGY)
column28: ICE BRIDGE SUPPORT OFR 2010 ACTIVITIES.  THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE THE PERSONNEL, MATERIALS, FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO OPERATION ICEBRIDGE BY MONITORING DYNAMIC AREAS AND ICESAT GROUND TRACKS OVER THE ICE SHEET IN EAST ANTARCTICA. UT'S UNIQUE SUITE OF GEOPHYSICAL INSTRUMENTS AND EXISTING FLIGHT CAMPAIGN, WHICH SHALL FLY OVER ICESAT-L GROUND TRACKS AND OTHER DYNAMIC AREAS OF ICE, DIRECTLY ACHIEVES THE SCIENCE GOALS OF OPERATION ICE BRIDGE.

8) JPL IS ALSO REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN AND CONDUCT AN EDUCATION PROGRAM IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE NASA HEADQUARTERS EDUCATION OFFICE, THE ACADEMIC COMMUNITY AT LARGE, AND IN SUPPORT TO NASA STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES TO IMPROVE STUDENT RETENTION IN THE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) DISCIPLINES.

WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS:  JPL MAY PERFORM WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS.  THIS WORK WILL BE DESIGNATED IN TASK ORDERS ISSUED BY NMO CONTRACTING OFFICERS BASED ON TASK PLANS INITIATED BY THE CONTRACTOR.

THE CONTRACT IS THE SPONSORING AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION (NASA) AND THE CALIFORNIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (CONTRACTOR), A PRIVATE NONPROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION, WHICH ESTABLISHES THE RELATIONSHIP FOR THE OPERATION OF THE FEDERALLY FUNDED RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT CENTER (FFRDC) KNOWN AS THE JET PROPULSION LABORATORY.
THE CONTRACTOR, JPL, IS REQUIRED TO PERFORM WORK THAT IS DESIGNATED IN TASK ORDERS ISSUED BY THE NASA MANAGEMENT OFFICE (NMO) CONTRACTING OFFICERS.
 
NASA   SPONSORED WORK: JPL S PRIMARY MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE NASA SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE (SMD) IN CARRYING OUT THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES IDENTIFIED IN THE SMD SCIENCE PLAN.  THE FOUR BROAD SCIENTIFIC AREAS ARE: EARTH SCIENCE, PLANETARY SCIENCE, HELIOPHYSICS, AND ASTROPHYSICS. 
IN PERFORMANCE OF THIS CONTRACT, JPL SHALL:
 
1) SUPPLY A BROAD BASE OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES RELEVANT TO NASA PROGRAM AND PROJECT RESPONSIBILITIES AND ASSIGNMENTS.
2) FOSTER ITS UNIQUE RELATIONSHIP WITH A TOP-TIER UNIVERSITY TO FACILITATE THE INVOLVEMENT OF SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, AND STUDENTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY AND RESEARCH COMMUNITIES IN NASA MISSION AND IN SUPPORTING OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES.
3) SUPPORT NASA IN ENABLING PROGRAM AND INSTITUTIONAL CAPABILITIES.
4) DEVELOP SPACECRAFT AND INSTRUMENTS THAT ARE SENT TO VARIOUS DESTINATIONS WITH OUR SOLAR SYSTEM, INCLUDING EARTH ORBIT, PLANETS, PLANETARY SATELLITES, ASTEROIDS, AND COMETS.  THESE MISSIONS MAY BE ORBITERS, LANDERS, OR ROVERS, AND TYPICALLY INCLUDE CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGIES REQUIRED TO MEET SCIENTIFIC REQUIREMENTS.
5) PERFORM PROJECT TASKS INVOLVING: (I) AUTONOMOUS DEEP-SPACE, INNER-SPACE AND EARTH-ORBITING SPACECRAFT OR MAJOR SUBSYSTEMS, (II) EXPERIMENTS, INSTRUMENTS, OR OTHER DEVICES WHICH MAY BE CARRIED AS PAYLOAD ON SPACECRAFTS IN MISSIONS MANAGED BY OTHERS, AND/OR (III) GROUND-BASED SYSTEMS.
6) BEYOND ITS PRIMARY MISSION, JPL MAY PERFORM WORK FOR OTHER NASA MISSION DIRECTORATES OR OFFICES.
7) JPL IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OPERATION, RESEARCH, TECHNOLOGY INSERTION, AND MANAGEMENT OF NASA S DEEP SPACE NETWORK TO PROVIDE TELECOMMUNICATION AND OPERATION SERVICES, INCLUDING DATA ACQUISITION AND DATA DELIVERY REQUIRED TO MEET ESTABLISHED AGENCY OBJECTIVES.
8) JPL IS ALSO REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN AND CONDUCT AN EDUCATION PROGRAM IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE NASA HEADQUARTERS EDUCATION OFFICE, THE ACADEMIC COMMUNITY AT LARGE, AND IN SUPPORT TO NASA STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES TO IMPROVE STUDENT RETENTION IN THE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) DISCIPLINES.
 
WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS:  JPL MAY PERFORM WORK FOR NON-NASA SPONSORS.  THIS WORK WILL BE DESIGNATED IN TASK ORDERS ISSUED BY NMO CONTRACTING OFFICERS BASED ON TASK PLANS INITIATED BY THE CONTRACTOR.

TAS::80 0123::TAS RECOVERY ACT FUNDS RECOVERY - SMAAART TASK TITLE:  COMPOSITE CRYOTANK TECHNOLOGIES AND DEMONSTRATION DESIGN, ANALYSIS, AND TESTING FOR COMPOSITE LH2 CRYOTANKS
 
1.0	BACKGROUND

NASA IS EXPLORING ADVANCED COMPOSITE MATERIALS AND PROCESSES TO REDUCE THE OVERALL COST AND WEIGHT OF LIQUID HYDROGEN (LH2) CRYOTANKS. COMPOSITES ARE MATERIALS THAT ARE COMBINATIONS OF TWO OR MORE ORGANIC OR INORGANIC COMPONENTS. ONE MATERIAL SERVES AS A "MATRIX," WHICH IS THE MATERIAL THAT HOLDS EVERYTHING TOGETHER, WHILE THE OTHER MATERIAL SERVES AS REINFORCEMENT, IN THE FORM OF FIBERS EMBEDDED IN THE MATRIX.  A CRYOTANK IS A CONTAINER THAT CAN STORE VERY COLD LIQUIDS, IN THIS CASE LIQUID HYDROGEN.  THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE NEW AND INNOVATIVE CRYOTANK TECHNOLOGIES THAT ENABLE HUMAN SPACE EXPLORATION TO DESTINATIONS BEYOND LOW EARTH ORBIT SUCH AS THE MOON, NEAR-EARTH ASTEROIDS, AND MARS.  THE FOCUS OF THIS INITIAL 1-YEAR EFFORT IS TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP THE COMPOSITE CRYOTANK TECHNOLOGIES REQUIRED FOR A HEAVY LIFT LAUNCH VEHICLE (SIMILAR TO THE SATURN V ROCKET USED TO LAUNCH APOLLO MISSIONS) BETWEEN 8.4 METERS AND 10.0 METERS IN DIAMETER.  THIS TECHNOLOGY WILL SERVE MULTIPLE CUSTOMERS INCLUDING NASA, THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE (DOD), AND COMMERCIAL AEROSPACE COMPANIES.  FUTURE SPIN-OFF CAPABILITIES MAY INCLUDE LH2 CORE STAGES (1ST AND TYPICALLY LARGEST SECTION OF A ROCKET), IN-SPACE PROPULSION SYSTEMS (A PROPULSION SYSTEM IS A MACHINE THAT PRODUCES THRUST TO PUSH AN OBJECT FORWARD), ON-ORBIT PROPELLANT DEPOTS (A CACHE OF PROPELLANT THAT IS PLACED ON AN ORBIT ABOUT THE EARTH OR ANOTHER BODY TO ALLOW SPACECRAFT TO BE FUELLED IN SPACE), AND LIQUID OXYGEN (LOX) CRYOTANKS.  

OVER THE PAST 15 YEARS, THERE HAVE BEEN A VARIETY OF COMPOSITE CRYOGENIC TANK PROGRAMS AT NASA AND THE AIR FORCE.  EACH OF THESE PROJECTS HAS HAD SOME SUCCESS BUT THERE HAVE ALSO BEEN TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGES THAT HAVE MADE NASA RELUCTANT TO INCORPORATE THEM.  ONE OF THE GREATEST CHALLENGES THAT NASA FACES WHEN INCORPORATING ANY ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY IS BRIDGING THE MID TECHNICAL READINESS LEVEL (TRL AS DEFINED BY HTTP://ESTO.NASA.GOV/FILES/TRL_DEFINITIONS.PDF) GAP BETWEEN EARLY DEVELOPMENT AND INCORPORATION INTO FLIGHT VEHICLES (ROCKETS).  THE INTENT OF THIS CONTRACT EFFORT IS TO PUSH THE TECHNICAL MATURITY OF COMPOSITE TANKS FURTHER BY BUILDING ON THE DEVELOPMENTS OF RECENT PROGRAMS.  NASAS MOST RECENT COMPOSITE CRYOTANK WAS DEVELOPED UNDER THE NEXT GENERATION LAUNCH TECHNOLOGY (NGLT) PROJECT.  THE COMPOSITE CRYOTANK TECHNOLOGIES AND DEMONSTRATION (CCTD) ALSO HAS THE OPPORTUNITY TO BUILD ON NEW IMPROVEMENTS DEVELOPED BY COMMERCIAL AEROSPACE INTERNAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (IR&D) ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS LEVERAGING TECHNOLOGY INVESTMENTS OF INTERNATIONAL AND ACADEMIC PARTNERS, AND OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES.  BUILDING ON PAST COMPOSITE CRYOTANK SUCCESSES AND EVALUATING NEW STATE OF THE ART MATERIALS THROUGH EQUIVALENCY TESTING SHOULD ALLOW NASA TO REALIZE CONSIDERABLE MASS AND COST SAVINGS.

IN FISCAL YEAR 2011, NASA PLANS TO BEGIN A PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON INNOVATIVE IDEAS ENABLING NEW CAPABILITIES OR RADICALLY ALTERING OUR CURRENT APPROACHES TO SPACE SYSTEMS.  GAME CHANGING DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS (GCDP) ARE INTENDED TO BE CAPABILITY-ORIENTED AND DIFFER FROM TRADITIONAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT METHODS THAT ADVANCE DISCIPLINE OR CORE KNOWLEDGE.  THE GOAL OF THE PLANNED GCDP IS TO MATURE TECHNOLOGIES IN PREPARATION FOR POTENTIAL SYSTEM LEVEL FLIGHT DEMONSTRATIONS THROUGH SIGNIFICANT GROUND-BASED TESTING AND/OR LABORATORY EXPERIMENTATION.  NASA WILL MANAGE THE COMPOSITE CRYOTANK TECHNOLOGIES AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WITHIN THESE GUIDELINES.  

THE CCTD PROJECT WILL BE SPLIT INTO TWO PHASES.  THE CURRENT EFFORT DESCRIBED IN THIS SOW IS PHASE 1.     THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PHASE 1 COULD RESULT IN NASA ISSUING A SEPARATE 2-YEAR CONTRACT FOR PHASE 2 IF FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE.  PHASE 2 WILL LIKELY INVOLVE THE CRITICAL DESIGN, ANALYSIS, AND MANUFA

column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA ::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#10286::RP#  10286 CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THE WORK TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS MODIFICATION IS TO PROVIDE A TOOLED JOINT WITH SEALANT AROUND THE PERIMETER OF THE CAST-IN-PLACE CONCRETE INFILL OF THE LOWER GUARD WALL PRECAST CAP BEAMS.  THIS WILL ENSURE THAT WATER INFILTRATION DOES NOT OCCUR INTO THIS VOID, WHICH WOULD CAUSE DAMAGE AND DETERIORATION TO THE CAP BEAMS.  BASED ON THE GOVERNMENT'S EXPERIENCE WITH THE CONCRETE MIX THAT WAS USED FOR THE INFILL WORK, IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE CAST-IN-PLACE CONCRETE WILL SHRINK, OPENING A VOID BETWEEN ITSELF AND THE PRECAST CONCRETE.  ADDITIONALLY, ONE CAP BEAM WAS FILLED WITH CAST-IN-PLACE CONCRETE PRIOR TO THE GOVERNMENT DIRECTING THE CONTRACTOR TO TOOL AND SEAL THE JOINT.  THIS CAP BEAM REQUIRES SAW CUTTING THE JOINT AND FILLING THE CUT JOINT WITH SEALANT.

column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA ::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#10286::RP#  10286 CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THIS MODIFICATION ADDRESSES REVISIONS TO THE UPPER GUARD WALL (UGW) SKIRT PANEL BRACKET COVERS.  THE CONTRACTOR HAS DISCOVERED UNFORESEEN INTERFERENCE ISSUES WITH MOUNTING THE UGW SKIRT PANEL COVERS TO THE UGW THRUST BLOCKS.  THIS NECESSITATES THE CONTRACTOR TO REVISE THE BRACKET COVERS BY WELDING ADDITIONAL STEEL MATERIAL AND GALVANIZING PROTECTION.

column21: U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS - CIVIL PROGRAM FINANCING ONLY
column27: OTHER HEAVY AND CIVIL ENGINEERING CONSTRUCTION
column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA ::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#10286::RP#  10286 CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THE WORK TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS MODIFICATION IS TO CHANGE THE ANNULUS GROUT PLACEMENT REQUIREMENTS OF THE GROUTED SHEAR KEY AT THE UPPER GUARD WALL SHAFT CASING TO PIER CAP CONNECTION. THE ORIGINAL DESIGN DOCUMENTS INDICATED THAT THE ANNULUS GROUT SHALL BE PLACED IN-THE-WET CONDITION.  THE SHEAR KEY AT THIS LOCATION IS A HIGHLY CRITICAL CONNECTION FOR THE UPPER GUARD WALL STRUCTURAL SYSTEM. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT PLACING THE ANNULUS GROUT IN-THE DRY CONDITION WOULD PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY PRODUCT AND ELIMINATE ISSUES INVOLVED WITH THE APPROVAL OF AN UNDERWATER GROUT.  THIS MODIFICATION REPRESENTS PART II OF A 2-PART MODIFICATION, AND FINALIZES THE CHANGE IN CONTRACT PRICE AS ACCOUNTED FOR IN PART I OF THE MODIFICATION.

column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#::10286::RP#  CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THIS MODIFICATION WILL ADDRESS THE WORK NECESSARY FOR THE LONG TERM SHUTDOWN OF THE GOVERNMENT'S CONCRETE BATCH PLANT.  WORK WILL INCLUDE PREPARING THE CONCRETE PRODUCTION SYSTEM FOR SHUTDOWN, EMPTYING OF THE VARIOUS MATERIAL HOLDING BINS, AND PROVIDING AN OPERATIONS ADVISOR TO OVERSEE THE ENTIRE SHUTDOWN EFFORT.

column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA ::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#10286::RP#  10286 CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THIS MODIFICATION ADDRESSES MOVING 27,500 CUBIC YARDS OF STOCKPILED DREDGED MATERIAL AT THE VICTORY HOLLOW (VH) SEDIMENT DEWATERING AREA TO THE VH UPLAND FILL PLACEMENT AREA.  MODIFICATION WILL ALSO INCLUDE: CLEARING OF THE VH UPLAND FILL PLACEMENT AREA, INSTALLATION OF EROSION AND SEDIMENT CONTROL MEASURES (INCLUDING USE OF SEDIMENT FILTER LOGS), TRAFFIC CONTROL FLAGGERS AT THE HAUL ROAD BRIDGE CROSSING, PRE AND POST TOPOGRAPHIC SURVEYS OF BOTH STOCKPILE AND FINAL PLACEMENT AREAS, AND FINAL SEEDING OF STOCKPILE AND FINAL PLACEMENT AREAS.

column28: TAS::96 3134::TAS ARRA ::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#10286::RP#  10286 CONTRACT FOR UPPER&LOWER GUARD WALLS, CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA AT CHARLEROI L/D, MONONGAHELA RIVER, PA.  THIS MODIFICATION ADDRESSES THE REMOVAL AND DISPOSAL AT A LICENSED RESIDUAL WASTE FACILITY OF APPROXIMATELY 250 CUBIC YARDS OF STOCKPILED EXCAVATED MATERIAL FROM THE PRECAST STORAGE AREA LOCATED AT THE CHARLEROI LOCK AND DAM UPPER GUIDE WALL AREA, AND APPROXIMATELY 500 CUBIC YARDS OF EXCAVATED MATERIAL FROM THE PRECAST STORAGE AREA STOCKPILED AT THE VICTORY HOLLOW SITE (APPROXIMATE TOTAL OF 750 CUBIC YARDS). BASED ON DOCUMENTED SAMPLING TEST RESULTS PERFORMED ON THE STOCKPILED MATERIAL DURING THE PRECAST STORAGE AREA SITE WORK, THE MATERIAL STOCKPILED AT BOTH THE PRECAST STORAGE AREA AND VICTORY HOLLOW IS CLASSIFIED AS RESIDUAL WASTE DUE TO ELEVATED LEAD LEVELS, THUS NECESSITATING THE MATERIAL BE TAKEN TO A LICENSED RESIDUAL WASTE FACILITY.

THE WORK CONSISTS OF SUPPORTING THE CONGRESSIONALLY AUTHORIZED AND MANDATED OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE DREDGING MISSION OF THE FEDERAL CHANNEL LOCATED AT SAN LEANDRO MARINA (JACK MALTESTER), SOUTHEAST SHORE OF SAN FRANCISCO BAY IN ALAMEDA COUNTY AND WAS AUTHORIZED AT A DESIGN DEPTH OF MINUS 5-FEET FROM MAIN CHANNEL (STA. 100+00 TO 185+23) AND MARINA CHANNEL (STA. 00+00 TO 10+00), AND BOAT RAMP CHANNEL (STA. 0+00 TO 16+49).  THE WORK INCLUDES REMOVING APPROXIMATELY 88,000 CUBIC YARDS WITH UPLAND DISPOSAL AT A SPONSOR PROVIDED SITE.  THE PROJECT SUPPORTS MARITIME BUSINESSES, INDUSTRIAL-MANUFACTURING FACILITIES, COMMERCIAL&SPORTS FISHING AND RECREATIONAL BOATING.

TAS::96 3135::TAS ARRA::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#::322789::RP#
REHAB SERVICE/EMERGENCY GATES/TRASHRACK AT CHATFIELD DAM, CO
REHAB WATERTIGHT DOOR AT BEAR CREEK DAM, CO

1.	THE CONTRACT AS MODIFIED BY MODIFICATION R00007 REQUIRED THE CONTRACTOR TO LIFT OUT THE SERVICE GATES USING A WIRE ROPE HOIST. BECAUSE OF THE WAY THE HOIST WAS DESIGNED IT COULD NOT CENTER OVER THE PICK POINTS OF THE SERVICE GATES. THE CONTRACTOR PROPOSED A SOLUTION WHICH REQUIRED LOADS TO BE TRANSFERRED BETWEEN A STATIC CHOKER AND THE HOOK OF THE WIRE ROPE HOIST. DISTRICT OPERATIONS AND SAFETY ASKED THAT OTHER OPTIONS BE LOOKED AT THAT DID NOT INVOLVE TRANSFERRING LOADS TO A STATIC CHOKER. RN CIVIL AND WAZEE CRANE EXPLORED SEVERAL OPTIONS. RN CIVIL PROPOSED TO DESIGN AND FABRICATE A GATE STAND AS AN INTERMEDIATE PICK POINT INSTEAD OF TRANSFERRING LOADS. THIS WAS ACCEPTABLE TO THE DISTRICT WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT IT WAS ADDED SCOPE. THIS CHANGE IS FOR THE FABRICATION AND INSTALLATION OF THE GATE STAND.A1100-ARRA-RECOVERY FUNDS 

CD-M CONSTRUCTION DIVISION, CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT MODIFICATION R00008, $11,658.00, 31 DAYS TE

TAS::97 0501::TAS ARRA::YES::ARRA RECOVERYPROJECT#::328513::RP#

EVANS ARMY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL ALTERATION AT FORT CARSON, CO

THE SMOKE CONTROL RELAYS ASSOCIATED WITH AHU#6 AND AHU#4 ARE CROSS-WIRED AND NOT FUNCTIONING CORRECTLY.  THIS MEANS THAT THE WRONG SMOKE ZONES GO INTO ALARM FROM WHAT ZONE SHOULD GO INTO ALARM.  THE SMOKE CONTROL RELAY(SCR) MUST BE TROUBLESHOOT/RECONFIGURED IN SMOKE CONTROL ZONE 9. CURRENTLY SCR'S TIED INTO AHU6 SHOULD BE TIED INTO AHU4.  ADDITIONALLY, ZONE 7 ON THE 3RD FLOOR EAST IS FED FROM 2 AHU (4,15). SUGGEST SEPARATING THIS THROUGH DAMPERS OR SEPARATE ZONES. GLOBAL RENEW WOMEN¿S HEALTH, UNIT PHASE B INDICATES THIS (DWGS M2.N1, M2.N2, M2.S1, M2.S2). TO GIVE AN EXAMPLE OF A POTENTIAL ISSUE, SEE THE ATTACHED DRAWING. IF ZONE 7 GOES INTO EVACUATION, THEN AHU4/15 EVACUATE. AT THAT POINT ZONE 9 RIGHT NEXT DOOR WILL EVACUATE AS WELL DUE TO THE FACT IT IS ON AHU 4. IN THIS SITUATION, IT SHOULD ACTUALLY BE PRESSURIZING.  ANOTHER QUESTION IS THE IMPACT THE 4TH FLR PRESSURIZATION WOULD HAVE ON THE AREA BELOW THAT IS TIED INTO MULTIPLE AHUS. WE MAY BE IMPACTING OTHER AREAS THAT WE WERE NOT EVEN PLANNING ON LOOKING AT.

CD-M CONSTRUCTION DIVISION, CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT MODIFICATION R00031, $24,396.00

column25: R&D- DEFENSE SYSTEM: ELECTRONICS/COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT (OPERATIONAL SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT)
column28: THE PURPOSE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO PROVIDE THE INTEGRATED COMMUNICATIONS AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS (ICIS) DIVISION, THROUGH THE MISSION SYSTEMS ENGINEERING BRANCH (AIR-4.5.10.3), THE INTEGRATIONS AND ENGINEERING SUPPORT ESSENTIAL TO MEET REQUIREMENTS FOR DEVELOPMENT, INTEGRATION, AND PROCUREMENT SUPPORT OF MISSION SYSTEMS INTEGRATION FOR GROUND-BASED, SURFACE, AIRBORNE AND SHIPBOARD PLATFORMS.
column38: SUBJECT TO MULTIPLE AWARD FAIR OPPORTUNITY

column9: NAVAL AIR WARFARE CENTER AIR DIV
column23: NAVAL AIR WARFARE CENTER AIR DIV
column28: THE SERVICES PERFORMED ON THIS CONTRACT SUPPORT NAWCAD TASKING FOR PROGRAMS SPONSORED BY THE NAVAL AIR SYSTEMS COMMAND (NAVAIR), NAVAL AIR WARFARE CENTER AIRCRAFT DIVISION (NAWCAD), NAVAL SEA SYSTEMS COMMAND (NAVSEA), THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE (DOD) AGENCIES, UNITED STATES COAST GUARD (USCG), COMMERCIAL ENTITIES AND FOREIGN MILITARY SALES (FMS).  THIS WORK WILL EMPLOY DISCIPLINES EMBRACING VARIOUS TYPES OF RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS, PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND DOCUMENTATION.
